sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The dependency conformance defines how Hologram components declare and manage their dependencies. This includes required, optional, and development dependencies, as well as conflict detection.

sections.title: Dependency Types
sections.content: Dependencies are categorized as: 'conformance' (required for structure validation), 'runtime' (required during execution), and 'build' (required during compilation/packaging).

sections.title: Version Constraints
sections.content: Version constraints follow semantic versioning patterns: >=1.0.0 (minimum version), ^2.1.0 (compatible versions), ~1.2.3 (patch updates only), 1.2.3 (exact version).

sections.title: Conflict Resolution
sections.content: Components can declare conflicts with other components to prevent incompatible combinations from being installed together.

sections.title: Usage Example
sections.content: To declare dependencies, create a {namespace}.dependency.json file with required, optional, and development dependency arrays.
